in_scope: RG-01: Navigate to 'My Reading Goals' page from user dashboard.
RG-02: Set and save an annual 'Books to Read This Year' goal (positive integer).
RG-03: Display current goal and progress count (initially 0) on 'My Reading Goals' page.
RG-04: Increment progress count on 'My Reading Goals' page when a book is marked 'read'.
RG-05: Update progress display on 'My Reading Goals' page after a book is marked 'read'.
RG-06: Edit and save the current year's reading goal.
Integration with existing user dashboard navigation for accessing 'My Reading Goals' page.
Integration with existing platform functionality for marking a book as 'read' to update progress.
Basic usability of the Reading Goals feature (e.g., clear labels, intuitive interaction).
Visual adherence of the Reading Goals feature to existing site styles.
Functional testing of the Reading Goals feature on the web application.
Browser compatibility testing on latest stable versions of Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox.
out_of_scope: Testing on browsers other than latest stable Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox (e.g., Safari, Edge, Internet Explorer).
User authentication (login/logout process) and user registration flow testing.
Major UI redesign or extensive usability testing beyond basic checks.

test_approach_summary.methodology: Manual testing based on documented requirements (RG-01 to RG-06) and exploratory testing for usability and edge cases on the web platform.

test_schedule.activity: Functional Execution - All Requirements (RG-01 to RG-06) & Basic Usability

assumptions: The development build for the 'Reading Goals Tracker' feature will be delivered by EOD 2024-07-29 and deployed to a stable, accessible test environment by the QA Start Date of 2024-07-30.
The provided feature requirements (RG-01 to RG-06) and technical notes are complete, accurate, and will remain unchanged throughout the testing phase.
risks: Delay in the delivery of the testable build from development, which would reduce the time available for test execution and potentially impact coverage.
Discovery of a high number of critical or complex defects, particularly late in the execution phase, may require extensive re-testing and could jeopardize the QA Complete Date of 2024-08-09.
